items.title: Trump administration, Musk’s DOGE plan to fire nearly all CFPB staff and wind down agency, employees say
items.content: Employees testified that CFPB leaders and Elon Musk's DOGE want to wind down the agency to five employees, the minimum required under law.
items.contentSnippet: Employees testified that CFPB leaders and Elon Musk's DOGE want to wind down the agency to five employees, the minimum required under law.

items.title: American Airlines to start testing free inflight Wi-Fi
items.content: American is under pressure to offer free in-flight internet after more airlines have begun offering the complimentary service.
items.contentSnippet: American is under pressure to offer free in-flight internet after more airlines have begun offering the complimentary service.

items.title: Egg prices are threatening a classic holiday tradition: Easter dye kits
items.content: The makers of Easter egg dye kits are bracing for the potential fallout if the egg shortage doesn't begin to clear up before the April 20 holiday.
items.contentSnippet: The makers of Easter egg dye kits are bracing for the potential fallout if the egg shortage doesn't begin to clear up before the April 20 holiday.

items.title: Venu is done. Here's how Fox, Disney and WBD plan to go it alone in sports streaming
items.content: Fox, Disney and Warner Bros. Discovery disbanded their efforts to launch Venu, a joint sports streaming service.
items.contentSnippet: Fox, Disney and Warner Bros. Discovery disbanded their efforts to launch Venu, a joint sports streaming service.

items.title: Senators grill Trump’s CFPB director pick: You are 'on the Titanic, good luck’
items.content: Since acting CFPB Director Russell Vought took over, the agency closed its Washington HQ, fired staff and told those who remain to stop nearly all work.
items.contentSnippet: Since acting CFPB Director Russell Vought took over, the agency closed its Washington HQ, fired staff and told those who remain to stop nearly all work.

items.title: Elon Musk says he's sending Starlink tech to FAA while saying, without evidence, that air safety is 'at risk'
items.content: Executives at major airlines told CNBC on Thursday that they do not see the FAA infrastructure as an immediate safety risk.
items.contentSnippet: Executives at major airlines told CNBC on Thursday that they do not see the FAA infrastructure as an immediate safety risk.

items.title: Paramount ends DEI policies, cites Trump executive order
items.content: Paramount Global announced it is ending numerous diversity, equity and inclusion policies to comply with President Trump's executive order banning the practice.

items.title: Pending home sales drop to the lowest level on record in January
items.content: Home prices nationally are still higher than they were a year ago.
items.contentSnippet: Home prices nationally are still higher than they were a year ago.

items.title: Trump’s proposed 'gold card' visa comes with a hidden tax break for the wealthy
items.content: President Donald Trump's proposed $5 million "gold card" for U.S. residency would be one the most expensive in the world, according to experts.

items.title: WBD adds 6.4 million Max subscribers, forecasts 150 million subs by end of 2026
items.content: Warner Bros. Discovery said Thursday it added 6.4 million global streaming subscribers in the fourth quarter for a total of 116.9 million subscribers.
items.contentSnippet: Warner Bros. Discovery said Thursday it added 6.4 million global streaming subscribers in the fourth quarter for a total of 116.9 million subscribers.

items.title: FDA cancels vaccine advisory meeting for choosing flu strains for next season's shots
items.content: It comes as RFK Jr., a vaccine skeptic who now leads the Department of Health and Human Services, makes moves that could affect vaccination uptake and policy.

items.title: Musk praises Bezos' new rules for Washington Post opinion pages as top editor resigns

items.contentSnippet: Jeff Bezos said that Washington Post editorial page editor David Shipley decided to resign rather than lead the opinion section under the new policy.

items.title: After abrupt departure of Lucid CEO, here are the EV maker's top priorities
items.content: Interim CEO Marc Winterhoff said Lucid's top priorities include doubling vehicle production in 2025, narrowing losses and increasing customer awareness.

items.title: Eli Lilly plans at least $27 billion in new U.S. manufacturing investments

items.title: TJ Maxx parent company says it will benefit from chaotic market conditions after strong holiday

items.title: Democrat senators question what Elon Musk plans to do with sensitive CFPB data

items.title: How digitally native companies like Rothy's are growing profitably in a new era for retail
items.content: Flats maker Rothy's is growing profitably after expanding into wholesale and building its store fleet. In 2024, it saw sales grow 17%.

items.title: Jamie Dimon calls U.S. government 'inefficient' and says Elon Musk's DOGE effort 'needs to be done'

items.title: Once high-flying Bluebird Bio sells itself to private equity after tough times for the gene therapy maker
items.content: Bluebird Bio will sell itself to private equity firms Carlyle and SK Capital for about $30 million, the company said Friday.

items.title: UnitedHealth's rough stretch continues, with buyouts, a reported DOJ probe and a 23% drop in three months
items.content: It extends a tumultuous period for UnitedHealth marked by the killing of a top executive, a costly cyberattack against its subsidiary and high medical costs.

items.title: Shortage of Novo Nordisk's Wegovy and Ozempic drugs is resolved, FDA says
